intro: Byrsonima viminifolia var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf strangler fig, is a woody shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible, fig-like fruits that are a source of nutrition for various wildlife. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Its rapid growth and ability to form dense thickets make it an important component of tropical ecosystems.
